snippet: A bomber blew himself up Saturday morning near Western embassies and the headquarters of NATO forces, killing at least four civilians, Afghan officials said.
abstract: Suicide bomber penetrates closely defended part of Kabul, Afghanistan, blowing himself up a few hundred yards from international embassies and NATO headquarters, killing at least six Afghan civilians, including some children; Taliban claims responsibility, saying target was a nearby Central Intelligence Agency installation.

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and JAWAD SUKHANYAR
byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi and an employee of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A bomber blew himself up Saturday morning near Western embassies and the headquarters of NATO forces, killing at least four civilians, Afghan officials said.

headline.seo: Suicide Strike Near NATO Headquarters in Afghanistan
headline.main: Bomber Strikes Near NATO Office in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Bomber Strikes Near NATO Office in Afghanistan
